intro: Matelea neblinae, commonly known as the cloud forest matelea, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, adapted for pollination by specific insects. It thrives in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
